into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.
the Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem.

42.long: already; now at length, now after all this waiting.

42.brief: I come into being, am born
42.long: I come into being, am born, become, come about, happen.
of time: when, after; of cause: since, because; otherwise: else.
the day of preparation, the day before the Sabbath, Friday.

43.long: (a) comely, seemly, decorous, (b) of honorable position (in society), wealthy, influential.

43.brief: a member of a city council, of the Sanhedrin
43.long: a member of a city council, in NT of the Sanhedrin at Jerusalem.

43.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
43.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
(a) I await, expect, (b) I receive, welcome (originally: to my house), (c) I accept.
kingship, sovereignty, authority, rule, especially of God, both in the world, and in the hearts of men; hence: kingdom, in the concrete sense.
I dare, endure, am bold, have courage, make up the mind.

43.brief: I go in, come in, enter
43.long: I go in, come in, enter.
body, flesh; the body of the Church.
Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.

44.brief: but, on the other hand, and
44.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
(a) intrans: I wonder, marvel, (b) trans: I wonder at, admire.
already; now at length, now after all this waiting.
I die, am dying, am dead.
a centurion, an officer commanding about a hundred infantry in the Roman army.

44.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
44.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
of old, long ago, in times past, former.

44.brief: I am dying, am about to die
44.long: I am dying, am about to die, wither, decay.

45.brief: I come to know, learn, realize
45.long: I am taking in knowledge, come to know, learn; aor: I ascertained, realized.
a centurion, an officer commanding about a hundred infantry in the Roman army.
a fall; a carcass, corpse, dead body.

46.long: (a) I take down, pull down, depose, destroy.

46.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
46.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

46.brief: I wrap up, roll up in something
46.long: I wrap up, roll up in (something), wind in.
(a) I lay down, deposit, (b) mid: I lay down or deposit a favor, with the view of receiving one in return, seek favor.

46.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
46.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

46.brief: from out, out from among, from
46.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.
a rock, ledge, cliff, cave, stony ground.
I roll to, roll up against.
a stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building.

46.brief: on, to, against, on the basis of, at
46.long: on, to, against, on the basis of, at.

47.brief: but, on the other hand, and
47.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
Mary, Miriam, (a) the mother of Jesus, (b) of Magdala, (c) sister of Martha and Lazarus, (d) wife of Cleopas, (e) mother of John Mark, (f) a Christian woman in Rome.
Mary, Miriam, (a) the mother of Jesus, (b) of Magdala, (c) sister of Martha and Lazarus, (d) wife of Cleopas, (e) mother of John Mark, (f) a Christian woman in Rome.
(Hebrew), Joses (a) son of Eliezer, (b) son of Mary, half-brother of Jesus, (c) surnamed Barnabas (also called Joseph).
I look at, gaze, behold; I see, experience, discern; I partake of.
where, somewhere, anywhere; with numerals: somewhere about.
I put, place, lay, set, fix, establish.
